content: 9/11 happened at the start of my freshman year in high school, and I remember world religions, including Islam, being incorporated into world history lessons afterward. The textbooks we used in TX, however, did offer similar information about Christianity, Judaism, Buddhism, and Hinduism. It was not an endorsement for or against any of the religions, but rather “this religion believes these core principles, is based on this/these text(s), and this is how this religion influenced world history.” Our teacher informed us that there were books on religious topics in the library if we wished to read further. I thought it was an excellent way to handle things.
